flawed_nl_solution:
In the full decks, John has a total of 52 cards in a full deck of cards * 3 full decks of cards = <<52*3=165>>165 cards.
A half-full deck of cards contains 52 cards in a full deck of cards / 2 = <<52/2=26>>26 cards.
So from the half-full decks, John has a total of 26 cards * 3 half-full decks = <<26*3=78>>78 cards.
This is a total of 165 cards from full decks + 78 cards from half-full decks = <<165+78=243>>243 cards.
After throwing some in the trash, he now holds a total of 243 cards - 34 trashed cards = <<243-34=209>>209 cards.
#### 209

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 156, not 165. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
